tasks.task: Managing soil health through crop rotation
subtasks: Understanding the role of crop rotation in preventing pests and diseases
Recognizing the importance of soil fertility and structure in crop rotation
Identifying soil-borne diseases and nematodes in a specific field
Selecting non-host crops to reduce pathogen and nematode populations
Designing a diverse crop rotation plan with appropriate sequences and cover crops
Adapting the crop rotation to local conditions and infestation levels
Using specialized databases (e.g., Best for Soil) to inform crop rotation decisions
Implementing cover crops and green manures to maintain soil health
